Pat,

Do you really want to measure coverage of the test code? I don't bot=
her to instrument it.

- Neil
 
> Simple question - when using the JUnit 'f=
ail()' method to fail a test
> when I expect an exception to be thrown (as =
per the JUnit
> documentation), surely *ALL* code coverage tools will repor=
t that the
> 'fail()' statement is never executed (since my test correctly =
throws
> the expected exception):
> 
>   try {
>     doWork();
>     fail("=
Exception should be thrown - GET CODE COVERAGE WARNING!");
>   }
>   catch =
(Exception e) {
>     // Success!!
>   }
> 
> Should I try and rework this =
code, or can I configure Clover (the tool
> I'm currently using that causes=
 me this problem) to tell it to ignore
> JUnit 'fail()' calls?
